meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here to dish out the dirt on Songs of Conquest!

I'm not gonna lie, when I first heard about this turn-based tactics anthology, I thought it was just another pretender to the Heroes of Might and Magic throne. But boy, oh boy, did Lavapotion prove me wrong! This gorgeous game has got heart, folks, and that's what sets it apart from the rest.

Now, let's get to the good stuff – the gameplay! Songs of Conquest is all about strategic battles, exploring a vast world, and mastering four playable factions. And trust me, each one is unique and well-characterized (sorry, GameStar, no quotation forthcoming for you!). You'll be busy building armies, researching techs, and making tough decisions on the fly.

But don't just take my word for it! The critics are raving about this indie gem. Eurogamer gave it a 60 out of 100, praising its ambition and heart. God is a Geek was even more effusive, calling it "a stand-out hit." IGN Italia echoed those sentiments, saying Songs of Conquest is both nostalgic and modern.

Now, I know what you're thinking – what about the flaws? Well, The Games Machine noted some issues with the single-player campaign, but overall, Lavapotion's game delivers on its promise. PC Games gave it an 80 out of 100, commending its gameplay values. And finally, TheGamer summed it up nicely: "a golden example of turn-based strategy games done right."

So there you have it – Songs of Conquest is the real deal! It's a loving tribute to Heroes of Might and Magic, with just enough personal touches to make it feel fresh and exciting. Don't miss out on this modern masterpiece!
